newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Chubais outlines tasks in Russian Finance Ministry.
newsitem.headline: Chubais outlines tasks in Russian Finance Ministry.

text.p: Finance Minister Anatoly Chubais on Friday outlined the responsibilities of his three first deputy prime ministers, putting Alexei Kudrin in charge of policy on government debt, including Eurobonds.
Chubais told a news conference that Kudrin would be in charge of government debt policy and social reforms, including reform of utilities for households.
He will head the finance ministry's foreign currency department, except for tax collection and public relations.

His deputies include Mikhail Kasyanov, the ministry's point man for Eurobond issues and foreign debt and Oleg Vyugin, who heads macroeconomic policy and relations with the International Monetary Fund.
Chubais said First Deputy Finance Minister Sergei Ignatiev would head the ministry's work on tax collection and tax reform.
Vladimir Petrov, also a first deputy finance minister, will be in charge of the 1997 and 1998 budgets, include sequestration for the 1997 budget, and military reform.
